properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the channel.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of channel. One of: campfire, email, hipchat, opsgenie, pagerduty, slack, victorops, or webhook.

properties.name: configuration
properties.description: (Required) A map of key / value pairs with channel type specific values.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: policy_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the policy where this condition should be used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The title of the condition. Must be between 1 and 64 characters, inclusive.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of condition. One of: apm_app_metric, apm_jvm_metric, apm_kt_metric, servers_metric, browser_metric, mobile_metric

properties.name: entities
properties.description: (Required) The instance IDS associated with this condition.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: (Required) The metric field accepts parameters based on the type set.

properties.name: gc_metric
properties.description: (Optional) A valid Garbage Collection metric e.g. GC/G1 Young Generation. This is required if you are using apm_jvm_metric with gc_cpu_time condition type.

properties.name: violation_close_timer
properties.description: (Optional) Automatically close instance-based violations, including JVM health metric violations, after the number of hours specified. Must be: 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 or 24.

properties.name: runbook_url
properties.description: (Optional) Runbook URL to display in notifications.

properties.name: condition_scope
properties.description: (Optional) instance or application. This is required if you are using the JVM plugin in New Relic.

properties.name: term
properties.description: (Required) A list of terms for this condition. See Terms below for details.

properties.name: user_defined_metric
properties.description: (Optional) A custom metric to be evaluated.

properties.name: user_defined_value_function
properties.description: (Optional) One of: average, min, max, total, or sample_size.

properties.name: terms
properties.description: » Terms
The term mapping supports the following arguments:

properties.name: duration
properties.description: (Required) In minutes, must be: 5, 10, 15, 30, 60, or 120.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Optional) above, below, or equal. Defaults to equal.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) critical or warning. Defaults to critical.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Required) Must be 0 or greater.

properties.name: time_function
properties.description: (Required) all or any.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the policy.

properties.name: incident_preference
properties.description: (Optional) The rollup strategy for the policy. Options include: PER_POLICY, PER_CONDITION, or PER_CONDITION_AND_TARGET. The default is PER_POLICY.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: policy_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the policy.

properties.name: channel_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the channel.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: policy_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the policy where this condition should be used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The title of the condition

properties.name: runbook_url
properties.description: (Optional) Runbook URL to display in notifications.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Set whether to enable the alert condition. Defaults to true.

properties.name: term
properties.description: (Required) A list of terms for this condition. See Terms below for details.

properties.name: nrql
properties.description: (Required) A NRQL query. See NRQL below for details.

properties.name: value_function
properties.description: (Optional) Possible values are single_value, sum.

properties.name: terms
properties.description: » Terms
The term mapping supports the following arguments:

properties.name: duration
properties.description: (Required) In minutes, must be in the range of 1 to 120, inclusive.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Optional) above, below, or equal. Defaults to equal.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) critical or warning. Defaults to critical.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Required) Must be 0 or greater.

properties.name: time_function
properties.description: (Required) all or any.

properties.name: nrql-1
properties.description: » NRQL
The nrql attribute supports the following arguments:

properties.name: query
properties.description: (Required) The NRQL query to execute for the condition.

properties.name: since_value
properties.description: (Required) The value to be used in the SINCE <X> MINUTES AGO clause for the NRQL query. Must be between 1 and 20.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: policy_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the alert policy where this condition should be used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The Infrastructure alert condition's name.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Set whether to enable the alert condition. Defaults to true.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of Infrastructure alert condition: "infra_process_running", "infra_metric", or "infra_host_not_reporting".

properties.name: event
properties.description: (Required) The metric event; for example, system metrics, process metrics, storage metrics, or network metrics.

properties.name: select
properties.description: (Required) The attribute name to identify the type of metric condition; for example, "network", "process", "system", or "storage".

properties.name: comparison
properties.description: (Required) The operator used to evaluate the threshold value; "above", "below", "equal".

properties.name: critical
properties.description: (Required) Identifies the critical threshold parameters for triggering an alert notification. See Thresholds below for details.

properties.name: warning
properties.description: (Optional) Identifies the warning threshold parameters. See Thresholds below for details.

properties.name: where
properties.description: (Optional) Infrastructure host filter for the alert condition.

properties.name: process_where
properties.description: (Optional) Any filters applied to processes; for example: "commandName = 'java'".

properties.name: integration_provider
properties.description: (Optional) For alerts on integrations, use this instead of event.

properties.name: thresholds
properties.description: » Thresholds
The critical and warning threshold mapping supports the following arguments:

properties.name: duration
properties.description: (Required) Identifies the number of minutes the threshold must be passed or met for the alert to trigger. Threshold durations must be between 1 and 60 minutes (inclusive).

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) Threshold value, computed against the comparison operator. Supported by "infra_metric" and "infra_process_running" alert condition types.

properties.name: time_function
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates if the condition needs to be sustained or to just break the threshold once; all or any. Supported by the "infra_metric" alert condition type.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: policy_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the policy where this condition should be used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The title of this condition.

properties.name: monitor_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Synthetics monitor to be referenced in the alert condition.

properties.name: runbook_url
properties.description: (Optional) Runbook URL to display in notifications.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Set whether to enable the alert condition. Defaults to true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The title of this monitor.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The monitor type (i.e. SIMPLE, BROWSER, SCRIPT_API, SCRIPT_BROWSER).

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: (Required) The interval (in minutes) at which this monitor should run.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Required) The monitor status (i.e. ENABLED, MUTED, DISABLED)

properties.name: locations
properties.description: (Required) The locations in which this monitor should be run.

properties.name: sla_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) The base threshold for the SLA report.
For SIMPLE and BROWSER monitor types, the following arguments are also supported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: (Required) The URI for the monitor to hit.

properties.name: validation_string
properties.description: (Optional) The string to validate against in the response.

properties.name: verify_ssl
properties.description: (Optional) Verify SSL.

properties.name: bypass_head_request
properties.description: (Optional) Bypass HEAD request.

properties.name: treat_redirect_as_faiure
properties.description: (Optional) Fail the monitor check if redirected.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: monitor_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the monitor to attach the script to.

properties.name: text
properties.description: (Required) plaintext of the monitor script.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) The title of the dashboard.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: (Optional) The icon for the dashboard. Defaults to bar-chart.

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: (Optional) Who can see the dashboard in an account. Must be owner or all. Defaults to all.

properties.name: widget
properties.description: (Optional) A widget that describes a visualization. See Widgets below for details.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: (Optional) Who can edit the dashboard in an account. Must be read_only, editable_by_owner, editable_by_all, or all. Defaults to editable_by_all.

properties.name: widgets
properties.description: » Widgets
The widget mapping supports the following arguments:

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) A title for the widget.

properties.name: visualization
properties.description: (Required) How the widget visualizes data.

properties.name: row
properties.description: (Required) Row position of widget from top left, starting at 1.

properties.name: column
properties.description: (Required) Column position of widget from top left, starting at 1.

properties.name: width
properties.description: (Optional) Width of the widget. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: height
properties.description: (Optional) Height of the widget. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the widget.

properties.name: nrql
properties.description: (Optional) Valid NRQL query string. See Writing NRQL Queries for help.
